metadata.title: CVE-2022-2590 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A race condition was found in the way the Linux kernel's memory subsystemhandled the copy-on-write (COW) breakage of private read-only shared memorymappings. This flaw allows an unprivileged, local user to gain write accessto read-only memory mappings, increasing their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
